Pre-Game Insights: India began their Asia Cup 2022 tournament with a thrilling win over arch-rivals Pakistan in the 2nd match of the tournament.

Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja remained the top scorers for the Indian team with 35 runs each, while Hardik Pandya proved to be the difference with his unbeaten 33 runs off 17 balls at the end, guiding team India to a 5-wicket win in the last over.

Indian bowlers impressed one and all with their performance against Pakistan, especially Bhuvneshwar Kumar & Hardik Pandya. Bhuvi and Pandya grabbed 4 and 3 wickets respectively, bowling out Pakistan in the last over of the innings.
Arshdeep Singh also picked up 2 wickets while Avesh Khan managed 1 wicket in the 2 overs he bowled.
For Hong Kong, captain Nizakat Khan has been the top scorer for his team in T20Is this year, scoring 249 runs in 8 innings with three fifties to his name.
Batter Babar Hayat has scored 217 runs this year with two fifties while striking at 134.78.
In the bowling department, right-arm offbreak bowler Ehsan Khan has grabbed 18 wickets in 8 matches this year, the highest for a Hong Kong bowler this year.
All-rounder Aizaz Khan has picked up 12 wickets in 8 matches this year while Mohammad Ghazanfar has managed 10 wickets this year.
With a win against Pakistan on their back, team India are expected to win this contest against Hong Kong and cement their place in the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup 2022.
These two teams will be facing off against each other in T20I for the first time. However, India has defeated Hong Kong twice in ODIs.
There are no injury updates from either team as of now.
